story_prompt: Instead of the Monkey's Paw, you find the Clown's Nose, which instead of granting your wish in the worst way possible will grant it in the funniest way.
output:
---

As I sat at my desk, staring blankly at the computer screen in front of me, I couldn't help but feel like something was missing. My latest story had been well received by critics and readers alike, but there was still this nagging feeling that I could do better. That I needed to push myself further as a writer. It was then that I heard a knock at the door.

I opened it to find a small, colorful package sitting on my porch. Inside, I found a strange object - a clown's nose. It was made of rubber and had a bright red smile painted on it. I picked it up, confused, and turned it over in my hands. Suddenly, a voice spoke to me.

"Hello there! I am the Clown's Nose, here to grant your heart's desire!"

I looked around, wondering if someone was playing a prank on me, but there was no one else in sight. The voice continued to speak, its tone cheerful and playful.

"So, what is it that you want? A million bucks? A dream vacation? A new car?"

I thought about it for a moment before answering. "Actually," I said with a grin, "I think I would love to be able to make people laugh more often."

The Clown's Nose chuckled in response. "Well, you're in luck! With my powers, I can make anyone laugh uncontrollably whenever you want!"

I couldn't believe it. This silly object had the power to bring joy and happiness to others? I felt like a superhero, armed with a magic item that could change the world (or at least, make it a little bit brighter).

Over the next few days, I put the Clown's Nose to good use. I used it to cheer up my friends when they were down, to lighten the mood during stressful meetings at work, and even to get a few smiles out of the grumpiest of strangers on the street. People would catch sight of me holding the nose and burst out laughing, unable to stop themselves. It was hilarious to watch, and I reveled in the joy that I was bringing to others.

But of course, as with all things too good to be true, there was a catch. One day, while using the Clown's Nose to cheer up a coworker who was having a bad day, I accidentally caused her to laugh so hard that she snorted soda out of her nose. She ended up with a sinus infection and missed two weeks of work. Oops.

Needless to say, I learned to be a bit more careful with the Clown's Nose after that. But overall, I was thrilled with how it had brought laughter and joy to those around me. And hey, sometimes a little bit of chaos is exactly what we need to shake things up and remind us to have a sense of humor.
